page.title: 09Manor Field School,Bur. Hill
page.content: The school was built in 1890. There were two buildings, one for Infants and the other for Juniors. We still use these buildings and call them East and West Victorian buildings. The Third years use the East Building and the Second years use the West building. The classes were bigger in those days and there were over 50 children in each class. The writer's mother was in Mr.Barkers class in 1958 and he is still at our school. There were about 45 children in each class then. In 1972 a new school, Birchwood Grove, opened in south east Burgess Hill and children were transferred there from our school. In l985 there were about 700 children in the school, with about 30 children in each class, and 25 teachers.
